title: How to Land on an Aircraft Carrier in a Flight Simulator

steps.headline: Fly into the upwind leg and keep your eyes on your altitude and speed.
steps.description: Fly at about 400 meters (1,312.3 ft) and 400 km/h (250 mph).

steps.headline: Make a turn into the ship and gently ease off the throttle, aim to drop in altitude by 100m down to 300m.
On the downwind leg, drop your flaps, gears, and arresting hook and maintain a speed of about 250 km/h (160 mph).
After having traveled for about 15-30 seconds, you will notice the carrier has reached the plane of your rear left elevator (look behind you).
steps.description: Keep your eye on the carrier and make a gentle 180 degree turn aiming to be perpendicular to the carrier.

steps.headline: Once perpendicular to the ship's stern, re-adjust throttle down as you descend to the carrier.
steps.description: Use your gyroscopic sight to aim in front of the bow of the ship (because it is sailing away from you).

steps.headline: Remember when approaching:
steps.description: Open your canopy. Lower your flaps. Lower your gear. Lower your arresting hook. Turn on your navigation lights.

steps.headline: Try to anticipate and look ahead in terms of the arc of descent, and adjust your throttle based on whether you are too low or too high off this course.
steps.description: 95% of the landing technique is correctly perceiving, adjusting speed and placement of the plane on this descending, concave arc.

text: Fly into the upwind leg and keep your eyes on your altitude and speed. Fly at about 400 meters (1,312.3 ft) and 400 km/h (250 mph). Make a turn into the ship and gently ease off the throttle, aim to drop in altitude by 100m down to 300m.  On the downwind leg, drop your flaps, gears, and arresting hook and maintain a speed of about 250 km/h (160 mph).  After having traveled for about 15-30 seconds, you will notice the carrier has reached the plane of your rear left elevator (look behind you). Keep your eye on the carrier and make a gentle 180 degree turn aiming to be perpendicular to the carrier. Once perpendicular to the ship's stern, re-adjust throttle down as you descend to the carrier. Use your gyroscopic sight to aim in front of the bow of the ship (because it is sailing away from you). Remember when approaching: Open your canopy. Lower your flaps. Lower your gear. Lower your arresting hook. Turn on your navigation lights. Try to anticipate and look ahead in terms of the arc of descent, and adjust your throttle based on whether you are too low or too high off this course. 95% of the landing technique is correctly perceiving, adjusting speed and placement of the plane on this descending, concave arc.
